---
title: "Syllabus"
---

By allowing researchers to integrate spatial dimensions into their analyses, digital mapping and GIS tools ultimately enhance our understanding of the phenomenon we are studying. 

This course focuses on: 

<ol>
  <li>Creating quality maps using polygons, points or pixels</li>

  <li>Discussing Coordinate Reference Systems (CRSs)</li>

  <li>Creating your own spatial features
    <ol type="a">
      <li>Using existing GIS files</li>
      <li>Geo-coding</li>
      <li>Digitising your own maps: old maps or aerial / satellite images (QGIS)</li>
    </ol>
  </li>

  <li>Implementing spatial analysis: density (heat) maps, spatial correlation</li>

  <li>Computing variables using geo-spatial information (geo-computation)
    <ol type="a">
      <li>Calculating distances</li>
      <li>Implementing spatial joins</li>
      <li>Computing zonal statistics</li>
    </ol>
  </li>
</ol>


The course mostly relies on R but will also introduce QGIS.
